poem:
### The Whispered Figures

In the hush of a September morning,   
numbers tumbled from locked drawers,   
waltzing past sleepy clerks  
who, button-eyed, unwound clocks.   
Fifty-two souls blinked, aghast,   
as sums turned sirens sang the breach.   
Words scattered, paper leaves in flight—  
A sterile autumn raked too soon.
